results.title: Twin Cities & Greater Minnesota Christmas Lights With Interactive Map
results.content: Nov 27, 2023: Scandia VinterLights! 14727 209th St N, Scandia, MN 55073. The highlight may be the holiday tree lighting at 5:30pm, but there's also an indoor craft market, music, free Dala horse cookies, hot cocoa and caroling around a firepit. Entire event runs noon-6:30pm.
results.raw_content:
Light It Up: Twin Cities & Greater Minnesota Christmas & Holiday Light Displays
Who knew there were this many homes decorated with amazing Christmas lights out there? The people who create this holiday magic year after year are Christmas heroes. They don’t do this for money (although some collect a little something for a charity), but year after year they get out in Minnesota weather and put up decorations for the community to enjoy. Why sit home and watch The Great Christmas Light Fight, when you can experience the magic up close.
Load the kids in the car, pack some snacks and popcorn and enjoy these dancing lights, giant candy canes, Rudolph reindeer, abominable snowmen, and glowing snowmen on your own schedule anytime before Santa’s sleigh arrives (or at least by New Year’s day).
We have also included some paid tours and Twin Cities-area community Christmas tree lightings in our lists of holiday light displays. Even if you can’t make the tree lighting event, check out these locations during December. Displays will be up all month.
Submissions are open for 2023. Leave us a comment at the bottom of this page. Feel free to recommend your own home or a particularly beautiful Christmas lights display. Tell us what sets your display apart. If you want us to link to your website or Facebook page, include that information, and we would be happy to share photos.
We always appreciate reader feedback. If you find any holiday light displays that are no longer happening or have a site to add, leave a comment, and we’ll share.
(We will update throughout the fall of 2023 until the end of the year)
Community Holiday Light Tours
Community holiday light tours are the secret easy button of the family holiday light drive. Take advantage of the maps created by these municipalities and community organizations. Fun idea: Combine your tour with a stop by the Canadian Pacific Holiday Train. We list all the Twin Cities stops here and on our calendar.
Bloomington, MinnesotaTour home light displays and vote for your favorites. Starting approximately December 8th. Find a tour map here.
Brooklyn Park, MinnesotaThe interactive map is live for 2023 and will continue to grow as residents add their homes to the tour during December.
Champlin, MN 55316The city will create a list of participating homes for families to drive by all December. Participants should sign up by December 1, 2023 and Champlin will provide a list by December 5, 2023 for community members to tour.
Chanhassen, MN 55317Participating homes will be lit from at least 5pm-9pm nightly and will be family-friendly. Google map and driving instructions will be posted on the City of Chanhassen’s website. Light displays will be lit from December 2-31, 2023.
Homes & Businesses Across Crystal, MN 55422The City of Crystal will be sharing participating home and business locations on an online map or grab a physical map at City Hall or the Community Center. December 3, 2023; 5-9pm.
Elk River, MN 55330Residents are encouraged to submit their home to be added to the Holiday Lights Tour. Month of December.
Residents are again invited to participate in Fridley’s Winter Light contest. Visitors can create their own custom lights tour around town using the city’s map of entrants. Maps and a list of winners will be available December 16, 2023.
Hastings, MN 55033Take a self-guided tour of holiday lights in Hastings. The City publishes a map of homes and businesses that have outdoor holiday light displays that will be available shortly after December 4, 2023.
Best night to tour: The Canadian Pacific Holiday Train rolls through Hastings on December 9th from 8:15pm to 8:45pm.
The city’s annual holiday light contest draws more than a dozen participants. Judging December 5-8th. 2023 maps will be available in early December.
All participating addresses will be posted around December 10, 2023.
St. Anthony, Roseville, New Brighton, Columbia Heights, Arden Hills, and Mounds ViewFollow this map of holiday lights in several north suburban cities.
Best Night to Tour: The Canadian Pacific Holiday Train stops on the border of Columbia Heights and Minneapolis on December 11th at 8pm.
Ramsey, MN 55303Grab a map from the city’s website and go on a self-guided tour. Residents can vote for their favorites. December 4-18, 2023.
Richfield, MN 55423Community members can nominate addresses for the holiday lights contest. All nominated homes will be listed on Richfield’s website for residents to enjoy at their own pace. Find a map here. Nominations are due by December 13, 2023 at noon.
Best night to tour: Enjoy the Holiday Lights Parade on Thursday, December 14, 2023 at 6:30pm. Find a parade map on Facebook.
STMA Mom creates a holiday lights tour of the St. Michael /Albertville area annually.
St. Paul Park, MN 55071The city encourages families who enjoy viewing holiday lights to explore St. Paul Park and nominate their favorites.
Best viewing dates: December 19-22, 2023, during judging.
Taylors Falls, MN 55084Taylors Falls is encouraging residents to decorate for the holidays and  turn on outdoor lights between 5 and 9pm, November 24, 2023-January 2, 2024.
Find living nativity shows in our drive-thru Christmas article
Spectacular tree lightings & dazzling festivals of lights
If you love the small town, Hallmark movie vibe, than these small festivals are the perfect way to mix the awe and wonder of holiday lights with a night of family fun. These ceremonies go all out with Christmas decorations and traditional activities, like caroling, hot drinks and s’mores and sometimes wagon or sleight rides. You’ll also usually get a chance to see Santa. If you would rather avoid the crowd, visit these locations any time in December after the festival.
109 West 4th Street, St Paul, MN 55102Rice Park is filled with thousands of lights each year. The public is invited to drive by the park or make it a walk-through experience to enjoy the lights throughout the winter. Lighting Ceremony: 5:30pm.
Shoreview Community Center, 4580 Victoria St. N., Shoreview, Minnesota 55126The grounds of Shoreview Commons will be lit for the holidays. Music and cookies follow at the community center. 6-7pm.
221 5th St E, St Paul, MN 55101Mears Park in the Lowertown area of downtown St Paul lights up tonight. Dress for the weather and hit the link for details on a possible ornament hanging or exchange. November 18, 2023, 4:30pm.
7100 147th Street West, Apple Valley, MN 55124Complete with caroling, cookies and cider. 6:15-7pm.
Nicollet Commons Park, 12550 Nicollet Ave, Burnsville, MN 55337Traditionally held the Wednesday before Thanksgiving, with music by local choirs, refreshments, Mr. and Mrs. Claus, 200,000+ twinkling lights, and a 30-foot-tall tree. 6pm. The park will remain lit throughout the season for guests to enjoy on their own schedule.
Taylors Falls, MN 55084Annually on Thanksgiving weekend when families are home for the beginning of the holiday season. Grand lighting of the main street and Santa Parade Friday with celebrations all weekend. 6pm.
Lakefront Park, Hudson, WISanta magically illuminates Lakefront Park with thousands of lights along the St Croix River. 7-8:30pm.
City Square Park, 100 E Main Street, WaconiaA tree lighting event with hot cocoa and visits with Santa. 6pm.
Depot Park, 402 Lake St E, Wayzata, MN 55391Tree lighting ceremony Friday night, with Santa and reindeer, a candy cane hunt for the kids and a parade of lights. 4:30-7pm.
Light the Night Tree Lighting takes place at 7pm. Delano’s Old Fashioned Christmas festival takes place Dec 2, including the Deladazzle Parade.
Along with the holiday tree lighting at 50th & France will be chorale singers, horse-drawn trolley rides and Santa Claus.  4:30-6:30pm.
Shopping and tons of family activities at businesses downtown before the street snowflakes light up at 5:15pm followed by the City Hall Tree lighting at 5:30pm.
The annual tree lighting plus treats, kids activities, choir performances, and a visit from Santa. 6-7pm.
Tom Ryan Park, 10802 Town Square Dr. NE, Blaine, MN 55449Besides the lighting of Tom Ryan Park, families can enjoy costumed carolers, a swing band, s’mores by the fire, hot chocolate and an appearance by Santa and his reindeer. Drive by any time after the lighting celebration. 4:30-7:30pm.
Central Square Community Center, 100 – 7th Avenue North, South St PaulComplete with cocoa, caroling and the lighting of the holiday tree. 5:30-6pm.
14727 209th St N, Scandia, MN 55073The highlight may be the holiday tree lighting at 5:30pm, but there’s also an indoor craft market, music, free Dala horse cookies, hot cocoa and caroling around a firepit. Entire event runs noon-6:30pm.
Prairie Center, 8899 Nashua Ave NE, Otsego MNLocal talent and VIPs will be on hand to light the holiday tree, plus cocoa and cookies. 6:30pm.
20785 Holyoke Ave, Lakeville, MN 55044Lighting at 6pm, musical performance by Lakeville South High School’s Encore Singers and warm beverages and cookies. 6pm.
Cottage Grove City Hall, 12800 Ravine Pkwy S, Cottage Grove, MN 55016There will be a festive holiday tree for photos along with Santa and reindeer, bonfires, kids activities, live music and food trucks. 5-7pm.
12260 Diamond Lake Road, Dayton MN 55327Join in for the holiday tree lighting along with other festivities – Santa photos, smores and hot cocoa, hayrides and a light parade. 6-8pm.
City Hall, 6000 McColl Drive, Savage, Minnesota 55378Cocoa, live music, a bonfire and ornament-making go with the lighting of the tree. 5:30pm.
Town Square Park, Afton, MN 55001Lighting of the Village Christmas Tree is at 6pm with FREE horse & wagon rides from 5-8:30pm. Event 5pm-9pm. Visit anytime after the lighting to view.
Mississippi Crossings, 307 East River Parkway, Champlin, MN 55316This free family event will light up the community gathering space with a 30-foot panel animated musical tree, 16-foot walk through displays (gift box and ornament) and snowflake light poles. Lighting ceremony 4-6:30pm. Park will be lit nightly until 10pm throughout December.
Lakeside Memorial Park, 95 East Broadway Avenue, Forest Lake, MN 55025Holiday tree lighting ceremony plus smores and hot cocoa, holiday musical favorites and a petting zoo. 4:30-7pm.
Veterans Memorial Community Center, 8055 Barbara Ave., Inver Grove Heights, MN 55077Tree lighting followed by Skate with Santa at the West Rink. 6pm-7pm.
19900 Nightingale St NW, Oak Grove, MN 55011The Oak Grove Fire Department is in charge of lighting up the community holiday tree. Warm waffles and beverages while you enjoy the display. And Santa visits! December 1, 2023, 5-8pm.
Boerboom Veterans Park, 416 Central Avenue Osseo, MN 55369Fire Engine Parade and tree lighting at 6pm. Pictures with Santa, a bonfire, caroling and other entertainment follows. Trees are lit along Main Street through the season. 6-8pm.
12716 Main Street, Rogers, MN, 55374A December tree lighting ceremony that includes hot chocolate, cookies and caroling from 6-8pm. Cruise by anytime after that to see the tree.
Lowell Park, 201 Water St N, Stillwater, MN 55082Enjoy holiday lights, sights & the sounds of Victorian carolers (Friday) & watch the dazzling community tree lighting (Saturday). Twinkle lights provided or bring your own.
Grand Avenue, St. Paul, MN 55105The great tree is lit outside Charlemagne Fine Jewelry around 5pm. The whole day is filled with exploring the shopping district, carolers, trolley rides, Santa visits and more.
Albertville Central Park, 5801 Main Ave NE, Albertville, MN 55301The tree lighting ceremony is at 5pm – don’t miss horse-drawn wagon rides, Santa, smores and more.
Anoka City Hall River Plaza, 2015 First Avenue Anoka, MN 55303 Tree Lighting is traditionally Friday evening of the first weekend of December. Enjoy horse-drawn trolley rides, holiday music, bonfires, and Santa.
Sturges Park, 505 2nd Ave S Buffalo, MN 55313Tree Lighting set is at 5pm, but come early for festivities beginning at 3pm with Santa’s arrival. Enjoy carolers, wagon rides, live reindeer, hot chocolate and cookies at more. 3-5pm and view the lights any evening after the lighting.
City Center Plaza, 7700 Market Blvd, Chanhassen, MN 55317Light up the plazas and celebrate with bonfires, refreshments, carolers, gingerbread house contest display, and a special visit from Santa!  5pm.
Rivers Edge Commons Park, 679 Main St NW, Elk River, MN 55330Festivities from 2pm-5pm ending with a Tree Lighting. Family fun includes Santa visit, goodie bags for kids, petting zoo and kids craft station.
Downtown, Lake Elmo MN 55042Celebration leading up to 5:45 tree lighting ceremony. Tree will be lit evenings after the event. 4-6pm.
3500 Plymouth Blvd, Plymouth, MN 55447The grounds of the Hilde will be lit tonight and remain illuminated throughout the snowy season.
Downtown, Shakopee 55379Christmas carolers, Santa, a tree lighting ceremony and fireworks. 2-6pm.
Town Center Park, 11800 Town Center Drive NESanta, Mrs. Claus & reindeer will be there and the holiday tree will shine. Lots of activities: caroling, bingo, story time, smores over the fire and hot beverages. 3-6pm.
North Plaza, 4th Street between Sibley and Wacouta, St. Paul, 55101Drive by the North Plaza any evening after the tree-lighting ceremony to see the the tree, which will be lit through December.
309 Lewis Ave S, Watertown, MN 55388Ceremony is at 4:30pm in City Center Park following all the Santa activities. 9am-5:30pm.
Railroad Park, 26755 Faxton Avenue Wyoming, MN  55092Lighting of the holiday trees plus light displays, a Santa meet, refreshments and entertainment. 4:30-6pm.
Chaska Event Center and Firemen’s ParkThe grand tree lighting plus crafts, outdoor games, hot cocoa and cookies & pictures with Santa Claus. 6-7:30pm.
Schedule your holiday lights drive to hit up one of four evening Santa parades by the Spring Lake Park, Blaine, Mounds View Fire Department. Bring a donation for the local food shelf. Parades begin at 6:30pm.
Eagan Community Center, 1501 Central Pkwy, Eagan, MN 55121Tree lighting followed by indoor and outdoor activities and an outdoor trail of lights. 4:30-7pm.
7550 Sunwood Dr NW, Ramsey, MN 55303Free cocoa, cookies and pictures with Santa at the holiday tree lighting event. Rumriver Art Center will offer a create-your-own holiday ornament class.
The event will take place at City Hall and includes a sing along, Santa visit and refreshments. 6-6:30pm.
Bayfront Park in Downtown Victoria, 1730 Stieger Lake Lane, Victoria, MN 55386The park lights up at 6pm followed by festive winter activities such as caroling, Santa Claus meets, hot apple cider, hayrides, llamas and dance performances. 6-7pm.
Boulevard Plaza, 11000 Crooked Lake Blvd NW, Coon Rapids, MN 55433Celebrate the lighting of Coon Rapids’ community tree with signing and bonfires. Holiday tree lighting countdown and fireworks at 5:30pm.
17565 Central Ave NE, Suite 200, Ham Lake, MNLighting of the Ham Lake Holiday Lights accompanied by activities such as Santa greet, alpacas and mini-horses, treats, ornament-making, holiday movies December 9, 2023, 3-6pm.
12590 Ridgedale Drive, Minnetonka, Minnesota 55305Festive events on the lineup include hot cocoa, crafts, a bonfire and music (4:30-6 p.m.), tree lighting (5pm) and a candy cane hunt (5:30pm).

Lighting festivals and events worth the splurge
For an extra-special and magical night out, these ticketed events and festivals can be so much fun. You can plan your tickets around special family days or around the weather. Consider adding one of these events to your Twin Cities holiday traditions.
3675 Arboretum Dr, Chaska, MN 55318Take a walking tour through the garden lights on the grounds of the Twin Cities’ favorite botanical gardens. Winter displays will feature flowers, nature and winter fun and even more lights than ever before. Nov 16 through December 31, 2023.

Pre-purchased tickets required:

Hastings, MN
Each year we add to our display. And keep Christ the center of our display. Not everyone has the time or ability to set up a large light display. I make the time each year as much for my children, as for all children, young and old to enjoy. We started small and now have added A few DIY pixel Light displays that are computer controlled to our display. We hope you enjoy and stop by anytime you are in the area as the display is always changing.
Merry Christmas!
The Luskey Family
